title: Do you even do anything when a player griefs their teammate for their champ selection?
body: Cause it happens a sickening amount of the times people break 'meta'. Almost as if this behavior was encouraged.

replies.body: Agreed, but sometimes (especially on the bot lane) breaking out of the meta (like choosing zed as a support, or sona soraka bot) is just not as effective as staying in the meta, and you often lose games because of that. {{champion:90}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:8}} are champs i jungle with sometimes, I get the flame too. Breaking meta is okay, but not if the champion can't really fulfill the role he's supposed to be taking, or if he hinders the others at playing. Like if an alistar support would always headbutt enemy champions back into their turrets, then he would get flamed too, even though he is in the support meta. If Zed is ksing on the bot lane the whole time and farming away the minions of and adc, then people are gonna flame the pick. Most of the time it's not the pick that's flamed, it's the playstyle. If you play your out of meta champion well in his role, then you probably won't get flamed as much. If they still flame, report them after the game. If you really wanna go that far, copy&quote an especially rude insult of his into the /all chat and ask the other team to also report if they care^^ Just don't become insulting yourself. It's hard, but possible.

DO NOT ASK FOR REPORTS. This is against the Summoners Code and can get you banned!
1 report per game is the same as 9.

See RIOT response here: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/jmF6VEou-riot-tantram-is-asking-if-the-enemy-is-also-going-to-report-reportable
Thank you, didn't even know that ._.

I agree with trying to fit the playstyle.  But what i'm talking about is beyond that.  People decide you're the reason they lost the game before it even started if you break meta, and this happens probably about half the games i play unless i conform to the most popular champs in a role.  Even then people get crazy about it, ie graves jungle or brand support.  These are very effective and roles for the champs and they are even in the meta, but people flip their lid the instant you pick something that isn't widely accepted at the role you're in.   There are jungle adcs on the regular and people still lose it completely if you don't take one bot.  Do we really need 2 every game?  No. But people are so willing to jump on anyone who does anything different that it doesn't matter to them and that's really sad.  There's not too much worse than being trapped for 30-60 mins(cause they never surrender) with a guy who has dedicated the entire game to blaming you and griefing you.
Sometimes you just gotta trust people. Not all of them are salty flamers.

If your kd and farm is good, then they can say what they want. By the way, thats why I support less penalties for queue dodging. If the people who can't stand that want to leave, they can. Even if you have to wait a bit longer, it assures you that you play with people who at least kind of accept your role.
